column2: A  Swan was seen today around the same time as I was doing the Secchi disk. Weather clear- lake calm. Temp 85 degrees F

Lake calm- sunshine- temp 72 degrees-  Spotted 2 turtles sunning on southwest side of lake. A family of geese (three gosling on northwest side of lake. A beaver swimming near my dock on the northeast side of the lake. Lots of dragonflies!

column1: Used the canoe of Laurie Mattson from Brule- WI  She held canoe steady so I could  collect samples.

column2: Pair of Loons with 2 larger babies noted today. Haven't seen them in a week. They are still here. Yea!

column1: Weather clear- warm 68 degrees  Lake calm

column2: Lake calm-partly cloudy- temperature 70 degrees.  A pair of loons swam close to my paddle boat as I was collecting data. A muskrat also swam by at this time. The dragonfly's are hatching since Sunday and there are many dead Mayflies  on the window since Sunday. Mosquitoes are abundant.

Lake had a slight chop. Abundant weed stalks around deep hole. Secchi disk had lots of weeds around every time I pulled it up. Went to several areas to test with disk. Large log found floating close to south central shore. This could be dangerous for boaters and tube riders. A flock of geese flew overhead. No other animals or birds noted. Several minnows seen around shore. Sunny day and warm 80 degrees
Ice totally on Half Moon Lake. Geese sliding around when trying to land

Weather warm 70 degrees- lake calm low wind. Trees are budding some flowers on fruit trees. 2 geese observed and a lone loon. When secchi dish lowered to level where no longer observed- and pulled up lots of elodea came up with dish.
slight wave on lake. No birds or animals seen at this time. Temp 68. Ben Michaels will be helping me with the secchi dish. He will test next week.

Temp 76 degrees. Lake slight ripple. Loon sounds noted. Swan seen in area of deep hole. Lots of pine seeds seen in North end of lake. Some lily pads emergent. Pond weed is about 1 ft down. Heavy rain the day before around 8-10 in. Lake level very high.
Lake very calm. A muskrat seen near my dock crunching something in mouth. Lake clear with large pond weed still under water. Weather warm . Ben Michaels will be reporting the secchi dish reading.

Warm day- humid with slight wind. Hawk circling over deep hole area. Weeds mostly submerged a few tops of large pond weed noted. Two inches of rain the day before collection and 5 inches of rain the same day after collection. Very warm humid day. Slight wind noted. Hawk seen above the deep hole collection area. Most weeds still submerged. A few tops of large pond weed seen. Green dots of algae seen around the shore. Very warm humid day. Slight wind. Hawk seen in sky around deep hole area. 2 inches of rain on day before collection.

column1: Most native plants still submerged. Some tops of large pond weed seen. Many pond lilies seen. 5 inches of rain later on day of collection. Small dots of algae seen along the shore.

column2: Lake is very high. Lots of small floating seed like from dandelions on the water. There is a slight chop low winds about 5-10 miles per hour. Sounds of loons on south west lake. Sunny warm day.75 degrees Lake is very high. Lots of small floating seed like from dandelions on the water. There is a slight chop low winds about 5-10 miles per hour. Sounds of loons on south west lake. Sunny warm day.75 degrees. Yellow pollen noted near shore floating on water.

Overcast- calm water- pollen on water (yellow) Large-Leaf Pondweed growing up to about 1/2 foot below surface. No wildlife spotted but 12 white swans seen floating on western portion of lake last week.

Lake very calm- no wind. Temp 75 and humid. Lots of dragonflies noted. Large pondweed emerging in many areas- submerged pondweed noted in many areas. One loon seen flying. Algae pods noted along the shores on the north side. Didn't go to the south side. Pollen still on lake- Sample taken at deep hole refrigerated until I can mail it on Mon. July 1-2019 No persons seen on lake at this time

Lake is calm. Temp is 73 degrees. There are many dragonflies around. The lake vegetation is now above water in many places. There is a large mass of green algae noted along the shoreline and in the middle of the lake on the East side where the deep hole is. There is floating- bubbling algae on the surface and masses of algae underwater. The trolling motor used clogged with aquatic plants often.  A pair of Loons seen with one baby in toe. Also seen a bald Eagle seen lurking in the tree tops  several yards away. Loons had not detected Eagle- so no cry.
Partly cloudy- slight chop on water- plant that were above water slowly dying down. Loon cry every so often.Many plants seen underwater. None of the slimy algae seen
Partly cloudy- slight chop on water- plant that were above water slowly dying down. Loon cry every so often.Many plants seen underwater. None of the slimy algae seen. Temp about 72 degrees

Lake calm- no waves. Temp of air middle 70's and very humid. Lots of bugs dancing on water. One pontoon boat on water and one fishing boat noted. My son Nick came out to help me by driving boat and manning the anchor. Lake calm- no waves. Temp in mid 70's and humid. Lots of water bugs noted. One pontoon boat and one fishing boat on lake.My son-Nick helped me by driving the boat and manning the anchor.  The secchi dish did not hit the bottom when tested and many plants came up with the dish. They looked to be large leaf pond
Very warm day 88 Degrees. Light chop on lake. Lake weeds are still submerged. One loon sighted. One bald eagle sited. My son-Nick- helped today. He drove the boat and handled the anchor.
Very warm- partly cloudy- lake calm with slight breeze. Very unusual to not see any surface plants at this date in July.

column1: Loon calls on lake. Assisted today by Adam Stegman and his daughter Amilie

column2: The weather is warm with some clouds. The water is slightly choppy. On the way out to the deep hole we saw a turtle.

column1: At the deep hole the secchi disk did not hit bottem. When the dish was pulled up there were lots of weeds on the disk. I would say they were large leaf pond. On the way back from the deep hole we were treated to a pair of loons with a baby avoiding a circling bald eagle. They kept looking at the eagle and diving in time. When approaching the dock- a muskrat  dove nearby.Busy day
